title: This Billionaire Is Now Even Richer Than Warren Buffett; Gautam Adani has jumped to the fifth richest person in the world with a $125 billion net worth, more than the Berkshire Hathaway CEO
text:
Mr. Buffett, the chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., is worth $120 billion, according to the index.

The jump comes after Mr. Adani earlier this month became the world's newest centibillionaire. His net worth has risen by $48 billion since the start of the year.

Most of the other people on the top 10 list—all of whom are men—have seen their wealth decline this year amid falling stock markets, though Mr. Buffett's net worth has risen by $11 billion this year.

Mr. Adani didn't immediately respond to a request for comment through his firm Adani Group. Mr. Buffett also didn't immediately respond to a request for comment through his firm Berkshire Hathaway.

While establishing the exact net worth of the world's wealthiest can be tricky, in part because many of their holdings are private, these rankings have often been a source of bragging rights among the world's richest, including Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos, who have sparred at one another over their respective wealth.

Mr. Buffett has publicly committed to giving away the majority of his wealth. He helped launch a campaign in 2010 called the Giving Pledge, in which he and others plan to donate a majority of their wealth to charitable causes, either during their lifetimes or in their wills.

Mr. Adani is founder and chairman of the Adani Group, a sprawling conglomerate with businesses in sectors such as energy, mining, real estate and agriculture.

Adani Group is composed of seven publicly listed entities with a combined market capitalization of about $220 billion, according to the conglomerate. One of the publicly traded companies, Adani Enterprises Ltd., has seen its share price nearly double over the past 12 months.

Mr. Adani now stands behind Tesla Inc.'s Mr. Musk, Amazon.com Inc.'s Mr. Bezos, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE's Bernard Arnault and Microsoft Corp. co-founder Bill Gates.

The 10 richest people are worth about $1.3 trillion. Mr. Musk tops the list at $252 billion.

The Bloomberg Billionaires Index measures personal wealth based on changes in markets, the economy and other reporting.
